nodes.text: Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner to remove mold release materials.
Sand old or new gelcoat to remove imperfections using DA sander and grade 80+ abrasive discs.
Apply dry guide coat and re-sand for even texture.
Mix Marine Blister Repair Filler and apply, then feather and sand.
Apply Marine Premium Filler in tight coat and sand with grade 120+ abrasive discs.
Finish by sanding repair area with grade 220+ abrasive discs.
Ensure surface is dry and mask areas with 3M™ Precision Masking Tape, then back it up.
Apply gelcoat using a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun and adjust settings.
Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Sand refinement using 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ and 400+ grade abrasives or P800 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Refine sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish and a wool compounding pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Refer to the following page for gelcoat finishing process (5 or 6-step options).
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 80+ grade abrasive discs.
Apply 3M Marine Premium Filler and follow the instructions for application and sanding.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix primer in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Sand the primer using dry guide coat and 320+ grade abrasive discs, then repeat with 400+ grade.
Mix marine paint in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun.
Choose between dry or wet sanding for finishing, depending on the instructions provided.
Sand with 3M Hookit Purple Finishing Film Disc 260L+ P1200/1500 grade or Trizact Hookit Clear Coat Sanding Disc grade 1500 and a DA sander with a soft interface pad.
Refine scratches using 3M Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 or Trizact Hookit Foam.
Evaluate product suitability and follow regulations.
Clean surface with approved cleaner.
Sand bottom surface using a dual-action sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 220+ grade abrasive.
Apply and cure 3M Marine Premium Filler, then sand with 120+ and 220+ grade abrasives.
Mask the surface when dry.
Apply bottom paint using a 3M Performance Spray Gun.
Use products only for industrial and occupational purposes.
Consult a safety professional or visit www.3M.com for regulations.
Provide contact information for 3M United Kingdom plc and 3M Ireland Limited.
